title: Koichiro Morita
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Playing career.
Morita was born in <a href="Higashiyamato%2C%20Tokyo">Higashiyamato</a> on October 28, 1984. After graduating from high school, he joined <a href="J1%20League">J1 League</a> club <a href="Vegalta%20Sendai">Vegalta Sendai</a> in 2003. However he could not play at all in the match behind <a href="Kiyomitsu%20Kobari">Kiyomitsu Kobari</a> and <a href="Daijiro%20Takakuwa">Daijiro Takakuwa</a>. Although he moved to <a href="FC%20Tokyo">FC Tokyo</a> in August 2005, he could not play at all in the match behind <a href="Yoichi%20Doi">Yoichi Doi</a>. In 2006, he moved to <a href="Japan%20Football%20League">Japan Football League</a> (JFL) club <a href="Sagawa%20Shiga%20FC">Sagawa Express Tokyo</a> (later "Sagawa Express", "Sagawa Shiga"). He became a regular goalkeeper and played many matches every seasons. However the club was disbanded end of 2012 season. He moved to JFL club <a href="SC%20Sagamihara">SC Sagamihara</a> and played many matches as regular goalkeeper. In 2014, he moved to newly was promoted to <a href="J2%20League">J2 League</a> club, <a href="Kamatamare%20Sanuki">Kamatamare Sanuki</a>. However he could not play many matches behind <a href="Takuya%20Seguchi">Takuya Seguchi</a>. In 2015, he moved to newly was promoted to <a href="J3%20League">J3 League</a> club, <a href="Renofa%20Yamaguchi%20FC">Renofa Yamaguchi FC</a>. However he could hardly play in the match behind <a href="Jun%20Ichimori">Jun Ichimori</a>. He retired end of 2015 season.
